title: Love Island twins Luke and Josh Packham were teenage strippers
text:
They're the hunky twin brothers who sent the women into a frenzy on Love Island Australia this week.

And their Tuesday night debut in the villa certainly isn't the first time time that Luke and Josh Packham have wooed the ladies.

Daily Mail Australia can exclusively reveal that the 25-year-old twins worked as male strippers in 2012, back when they were still fresh-faced teenagers.

REVEALED: Love Island Australia's Luke and Josh Packham worked as teenage strippers before shooting to fame on reality TV

The boys, who were just 18 at the time, performed at hens nights and birthday parties on charter boats for Stallions Afloat.

Sources told Daily Mail Australia that the pair were incredibly popular with the ladies and were even nicknamed the 'Packing twins' for their impressive packages.

Despite making plenty of money stripping, the brothers gave up the lucrative gig around the age of 19 to pursue more stable careers.

Naughty! The boys, who were just 18 at the time, performed at hens nights and birthday parties on charter boats for Stallions Afloat. (Pictured: Luke Packham performing)

Luke moved into landscaping, while Josh worked as a mortgage broker.

The hunky twins made an explosive entrance on Love Island Australia on Tuesday night.

They both pursued Cassie Lansdell immediately, causing friction between Cassie and new girlfriend Phoebe Thompson.

Impressive: Sources told Daily Mail Australia that the pair were incredibly popular with the ladies and were even nicknamed the 'Packing twins' for their impressive packages

The twosome also flirted with a number of other women in the villa, including Cynthia Taylu and Anna McEvoy.

'We're full-on, a lot to handle. A lot of energy. We're definitely double trouble,' Luke admitted.

'I've definitely been told more often that I'm more attractive than Josh,' he insisted.
description: They're the hunky twin brothers who sent the women into a frenzy on Love Island Australia this week.
